main_definition: Relating to electricity or powered by electrical energy, also used as an idiom to describe something surprising or exciting.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to the presence of electric charge or electric force
meanings_and_examples.example: The experiment demonstrated the effects of electric fields on charged particles.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Using or generated by electric power, as in electrical appliances and devices
meanings_and_examples.example: Our home is equipped with solar panels to generate electricity for our needs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Fully charged with energy; vigorous, lively, or exciting
meanings_and_examples.example: The crowd went wild at the concert, totally electrified by the performance of the band.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Expressing a surprising, impressive or unexpected quality
meanings_and_examples.example: Her speech was electric; it left everyone in awe with its passion and conviction.
